title: NBPD miRNA-seq
source_name_ch1: Umbilical cord blood from infants without bronchopulmonary dysplasia
extract_protocol_ch1: Starting from the total RNA samples, small RNAs were size selected and ligated for sequencing following the TruSeq Small Prep Kit Preparation (Illumina). Samples were sequenced on the NextSeq500 (Illumina) in single-end 75bp.
data_processing: Small RNA reads were frst trimmed from the 5' adapter sequence searching for a perfect match with at least the frst 8 bp of the adapter.
data_processing.1: All the reads without the adapter sequence (or with a mutated adapter sequences) were removed from the libraries. Then, a second trimming round removed the reads shorter than 16 bp and longer than 35bp.
data_processing.2: All remaining reads were used in a bowtie analysis, which consisted of aligning the reads to the human genome to predict new putative miRNA precursors. Putative pre-miRNAs was added to the list of 1600 known human pre-miRs from miRBase.
data_processing.3: All trimmed reads were then mapped using Patman against this complete human precursor catalogue allowing no mismatches or gap (to avoid mixing the very close miRNA species coming from the same family).
contact_institute: The Third Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
contact_address: 35 Liwan Rd, Zhong Shan Qi Ba Lu, Liwan District, Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, China
